titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2150) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 1994 for the United States Coast Guard, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-151, by Mr. Moakley.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2150 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by title. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries now printed in the bill. Points of order against the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute for failure to comply with clause 5(a) of rule XXI shall be waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 58.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 401 - 0 (Roll no. 387).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/23/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2150 (authorizing appropriations for the U.S. Coast Guard).
